chart.title: Electricity production by source
chart.subtitle: Measured in [terawatt-hours](#dod:watt-hours).
chart.note: "Other renewables" include geothermal, wave, and tidal.
chart.citation: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025)

Other renewables excluding bioenergy - T.titleShort: Electricity generation from other renewables, excluding bioenergy
Other renewables excluding bioenergy - T.titleLong: Electricity generation from other renewables, excluding bioenergy - Ember
Other renewables excluding bioenergy - T.citationShort: Ember (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Other renewables excluding bioenergy - T.citationLong: Ember (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Electricity generation from other renewables, excluding bioenergy – Ember” [dataset]. Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data” [original data].

Electricity from bioenergy - TWh (adapte.citationShort: Ember (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Electricity from bioenergy - TWh (adapte.citationLong: Ember (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Electricity generation from bioenergy – Ember” [dataset]. Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data” [original data].

Electricity from solar - TWh (adapted fo.descriptionProcessing: - While the Energy Institute (EI) provides a longer time series (dating back to 1965) than Ember (dating back only to 1990 for European countries and 2000 for other countries), EI does not cover all countries or all sources of electricity (for example, generation from bioenergy is missing). Therefore, when data from Ember is available for a given country and year, we use it as the primary data source. Where Ember data is unavailable, we supplement it with data from EI.
Electricity from solar - TWh (adapted fo.citationShort: Ember (2025); Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) – with major processing by Our World in Data

Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data Europe”; Ember, “Yearly Electricity Data”; Energy Institute, “Statistical Review of World Energy” [original data].
